intro: Faramea nitida, commonly known as the glossy faramea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with dark green, leathery leaves that have a smooth, shiny surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. Faramea nitida is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
